## Comprehensive workshop resource recommendation

I highly recommend the **Reproducible Research in Computational Ecology** workshop by Casajus et al. (2024), which provides slides and hands-on exercises covering all concepts discussed in this presentation including research compendium, version control with `git`, literate programming with `Quarto`, and reproducible environments with `renv.`

Here is the reference and the link: 

-   Casajus N, Bonnici I, Dray S, Gimenez O, Guéry L, Guilhaumon F, Schiettekatte NMD & Siberchicot A (2024) FRB-CESAB & GdR EcoStat training course: Reproducible Research in Computational Ecology. Zenodo. URL: <http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4262978> ([workshop materials](https://rdatatoolbox.github.io/))

I also highly recommend **The Turing Way handbook to reproducible, ethical and collaborative data science**. This is an open-science, open collaboration, and community-driven project.

Here is the reference and the link: 

-   The Turing Way Community, Becky Arnold, Louise Bowler, Sarah Gibson, Patricia Herterich, Rosie Higman, … Kirstie Whitaker. (2019, March 25). The Turing Way: A Handbook for Reproducible Data Science (Version v0.0.4). Zenodo. URL: <http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3233986> ([book material](https://book.the-turing-way.org/))


<br/>


## Some resources for understanding Reproducible Research

-   Repro4Everyone. ***Introduction to Reproducibility***. A beginner-friendly overview of reproducibility concepts and practices. ([link](https://www.repro4everyone.org/resources/intro-reproducibility))

-   The Turing Way Community. ***Guide for Reproducible Research***. Comprehensive handbook covering all aspects of reproducible research DOI: [10.5281/zenodo.3332807](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3332807) ([link to guide](https://book.the-turing-way.org/reproducible-research/reproducible-research.html))

-   Blankart K, Ivets M, Goetjes E & Miele K. ***A Concise Guide to Reproducible Research Using Secondary Data***. Practical guide focused on working with existing datasets.  ([link](https://katblankart.github.io/DataLiteracy/intro.html))

<br/>

## Some resources for essential tools and technologies


### Version control with `git` and hosting platforms

-   Bryan J. ***Happy Git and GitHub for the useR***. Step-by-step guide for R users to get started with `git` and `GitHub.`  ([link](https://happygitwithr.com/))

### Reproducible environments with `renv` R package

-   Ushey K, Wickham H & Posit. ***renv: Project Environments for R***. Official documentation for managing R package dependencies. ([link](https://rstudio.github.io/renv/articles/renv.html))

-   Maigné E. ***Package renv: présentation et retour d'expérience*** (French). Practical experience and presentation on using renv. ([link](https://elisemaigne.pages-forge.inrae.fr/2021_package_renv/presentation.html#1))


### Tidy data 

-   Wickham H, Çetinkaya-Rundel M & Grolemund G. ***R for Data Science***. Essential resource for learning data manipulation and the tidy data principles. ([link](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/data-tidy.html))



### Literate programming and `Quarto`

-   Knuth D. ***Literate Programming*** (1984). The original paper introducing the concept of literate programming. ([link](https://academic.oup.com/comjnl/article/27/2/97/343244))

-   Abrams H. ***Literate Programming - Introduction***. Modern introduction to literate programming concepts. ([link](https://howardism.org/Technical/LP/introduction.html))

-   Bray A. ***Introduction to Quarto (posit::conf 2024)***. Comprehensive tutorial for getting started with Quarto. ([link](https://posit-conf-2024.github.io/quarto-intro/))

-   Xie Y. ***With Quarto Coming, is R Markdown Going Away? No***. Blog post clarifying the relationship between R Markdown and Quarto. ([link](https://yihui.org/en/2022/04/quarto-r-markdown/))

-   Delmelle E. ***Introduction to Quarto***. Slide-based introduction to Quarto features and capabilities. ([link](https://ericdelmelle.github.io/introToQuarto/#/title-slide))

<br/>


## Finding repositories for your data:

-   ***Où déposer et publier ses données*** - recherche.data.gouv.fr. French government guide for data deposition and publication. ([link](https://recherche.data.gouv.fr/fr/guide/ou-deposer-et-publier-ses-donnees))

-   ***re3data*** - Registry of Research Data Repositories. Global registry to help find appropriate data repositories for your field. ([link](https://www.re3data.org/))
